data.text: @RachelHW11 As far as I can tell, if they do t have symptoms they get an unexcused absence and a detention. The Min of Ed seems to be trying discourage what they think of as parental anxiety.
@mandylibrary In the chart, where it says they "can" go to school, it's that really a must go to school?
@BR3NDA As long as RATs are unreliable positive cases are going to be missed at a huge rate. It should be symptom focused rather than just relying on RATs.
@mandylibrary So many kids who car pool with the covid positive, but the rules say you gotta go to school.
@KnitMeAThneed I did and the results won’t be back in a timeframe that makes it worthwhile. Healthline was as helpful as they could be yesterday, but PCR tests are way behind in AKL now.

@mandylibrary Understandably. On the basis that you may have it but RATs sometimes take days to detect it is it worth trying to get a PCR test? Especially as loss of taste/smell seems more of a Delta symptom than an Omicron one.
@mandylibrary Ugh. The people who perpetrate this sort of nonsense either have no kids themselves or haven't had any at home for decades.
@KnitMeAThneed It does and I’m extremely pissed today
@mandylibrary I’m sorry, that really does suck.
